name: Palazzo Brandano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Palazzo for three days and over New Years Eve. It was the end point of a two week trip through Northern Italy and by far was our favorite part. The Palazzo had a lot to do with that.
reviews.title: A Treasure in Tuscany

likes.liked: — The quality of the accommodations, the service and the food
likes.disliked: — Finding it (but they will help you and pick you up at a train station in Arezzo, 20 minutes away)

reviews.title: Fabulous!
reviews.text: First, we have to say that the service was first rate and obviously a priority for those who are running the hotel. Everything from arranging transportation from the train station, to helping us rent a car, and upgrading us to their best room simply because it was not booked, made us feel looked after at every turn. The three young men who are running the Palazzo seemed to be having the time of their lives and their enthusiasm rubs off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is simply beautiful and has been renovated to luxurious standards. We are generally frugal travelers and this is not a cheap place to stay, but we felt every Euro was worth it. The suite that we stayed in would be perfect for a honeymooning couple or for a rekindling romance in a more experienced marriage. Every detail from the linens to the bathroom, to the entertainment options (including Sky TV with many English options) are at a luxury standard. The frescos that appear throughout the hotel and in the rooms are simply beautiful. The Palazzo's website does not do it justice.
reviews.title: Amazing from Start to finish

description: Palazzo Brandano's beautiful suites, spacious rooms and charming apartments are all luxuriously and comfortably furnished with handcrafted frescos by famous Italian Renaissance artists. Each air-conditioned accommodation boasts a flat screen satellite television, DVD player, HIFI stereo equipment, mini bar, safety deposit box and internet access. Bathrooms are equipped with either luxury massage showers or Jacuzzi bath tubs. Il Brandano restaurant with its stunning terrace serves modern Tuscan cuisine and an extensive selection of wines.
